intro: Geigeria pilifera, commonly known as the hairy geigeria, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in dry and semi-arid conditions. Geigeria pilifera produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
